description: Learned borrowing from Latin meticulōsus (“full of fear, timid, fearful, terrible, frightful”), from metus (“fear”) and -culōsus, extracted from perīculōsus (“perilous”). Sense of “characterized by very precise, conscientious attention to details” is a semantic loan from French méticuleux.

adjectives.description: meticulous (comparative more meticulous, superlative most meticulous)

entries.meaning: Characterized by very precise, conscientious attention to details.
examples: Synonyms: careful, precise, painstaking, rigorous, scrupulous, fastidious, thorough; see also Thesaurus:meticulous
Antonyms: aggressive, carefree; see also Thesaurus:careless
